item.title: The Music Village
item.body: In a 17th-century house, you'll find all the charm of New York jazz bars with a succession of crooners and big bands every evening. The programme is high quality and the biggest names in jazz have set foot on this stage, which has become a benchmark in the genre. If your pocket tells you that this isn't for you, no more excuses because they've just introduced a student deal for 7.50 €. Open from 8.30 p.m. (for live music evenings, see Website diary)

item.title: Backstage
item.body: A good place to come and listen to live music in the evening, whether jazz or rock. Open every evening from 10 p.m.

item.title: L'Archiduc
item.body: The hazy charm of the Archiduc always works. Its thirties decor has something to do with it, of course, as do its armchairs and round balcony. Concerts are often held there around the famous grand piano, which occupies pride of place in the middle of it. Also to be enjoyed at the end of the evening, when you can come across a famous singer or two. Open every day from 5 p.m. 'til late.

item.title: Jazz Station
item.body:
In clean and modern décor, this place is 100% jazz

Check the website to know what's on!

item.title: Halles de Schaerbeek
item.body:
The old covered Sainte Marie market, the Les Halles building, is at the same time handsome, powerful, nostalgic and marked by its own history.
 
Today, the Les Halles building is a successful example of the reassignment of an industrial structure as a cultural centre, suitable for a wide range of combined uses. The Grande Halle (6,237m²), a multifunctional space bordered by a mezzanine (1,463m²), can accommodate up to 2,000 standing spectators, 750 seated. The Petite Halle (380m²), formerly the fish market, is also a multifunctional space for concerts and shows. La Ruelle, formerly the butter and cheese market, is now the access route to the Grande or Petite Halle. And the Cave is also capable of many uses and contains the bar.

item.title: Roxi
item.body: Close by the very "look-at-me" Châtelain district, the Roxi holds its own with some real touches of originality. Thursday evening concerts, ultra-trendy decor and rather pleasant dining. Open every day from 8 a.m. to 1 a.m.; WE 3 a.m.

item.title: Recyclart
item.body:
(Ragga / Drum'n bass / Electro) - Recyclart, you either love it or hate it but, whatever you do, don't miss it. A railway station turned into a cultural venue is not the norm. In any event, punk and skaters, crazy artists and others addicted to electro sounds feel at home there. And that's quite natural given the quite original and inventive selection of music they play there. Electroclash, of course, but also live reggae music and other happenings.

Check the website to know what's on!

item.title: Bizon
item.body: (Blues / Rock) - Nice little bar where jam sessions, blues and special vodkas come together year round. Don't miss the Bizon blood and other stimulating vodkas. Open every day from 6 p.m.
item.address: rue du Pont de la Carpe 7 Karperbrug

item.title: Beurscafé
item.body: (Electro / Break / Jazz) - The Beurs is first and foremost an amazing Flemish cultural venue that, with its contemporary design, has made its mark. So its long bar leaves room for a rather artistic and intellectual crowd. Music is ubiquitous, including DJ sets and live music for the initiated. In the evenings, they lounge around big communal tables in a general but very friendly and sociable hubbub, before moving to the various upstairs rooms and dancing the night away. Open Thursday to Saturday from 8 p.m.

item.title: MARNI CLUB
item.body: Chaque premier mardi du mois, le bar du Théâtre Marni prends des airs de club et vous propose un concert de jazz dans son ambiance chaleureuse ! Vous assistez à une pièce de théâtre ou un spectacle de danse à 20h30 au Marni? Le concert vous est offert ! Vous sortez du resto et restez sur votre faim ? Venez prendre un verre et laissez-vous surprendre par un piano, une voix chaude ou une guitare!

item.title: Sounds Jazz Club
item.body:
The Sounds is a jazz institution in Brussels. And it's fair to say that it has a full programme. Every day except Sunday, blue note addicts come to hear those double basses, pianos and drums in this little space located close to Place Fernand Cocq. Wednesday is devoted to more Latino sounds. Open from 8 p.m.

Check the website to know what’s on!

item.title: La Monnaie / De Munt
item.body: It was in this world-famous theatre that the revolutionary movement was born in 1830, during a performance of Auber's opera "La Muette de Portici".

item.title: Le Cabaret aux Chansons
item.body: Music with lyrics, jazz and original compositions live. Open 1st Thursday of the month, Friday and Saturday evening 8 p.m. - late
item.address: rue du Marché aux Fromages 22bis Kaasmarkt

item.title: Le Cercle des voyageurs
item.body: A skilful blend of tearoom and tourist office for travellers in search of something new. As you might imagine, the Cercle is not a place where you dance on the tables, gulping from a bottle. Instead, you go there to relax in a refined setting, a sort of nice, cosy space from the colonial age. The comfortable couches, ornamental mouldings in the form of a planisphere and a travel book area (for leafing through to your heart's content) go perfectly with exquisite nectars, alcoholic or otherwise, from all over the world. Open every day from 11 a.m. to 1 a.m.

item.title: Samaritaine
item.body: Café with show, literary cabaret, in a fine vaulted cellar. Closed Sunday and Monday Open 7.30 p.m. - end of the shows

item.title: BOZAR
item.body: Een van de grootste cultuurtempels uit de hoofdstad (architect: Victor Horta) waar zowel theater, film, dans en natuurlijk muziek op de affiche staan. Als er grote jazzartiesten naar Brussel komen, is het in de majestueuze Henri le Boeuf-zaal (bekend van de Koningin Elisabethwedstrijd) dat ze optreden.

item.title: Ancienne Belgique
item.body:
Do we have to introduce the Ancienne Belgique? OK then, The ‘AB’ is a dynamic concert hall for contemporary music, one the leading concert venues in Belgium, hosting a wide variety of international and local acts. It has the finger on the pulse of the music scene, oh and a perfect acoustics too!

Check the website to know what’s on!

item.title: Forest National
item.body: Forest National is since 1970 active in presenting concerts, musicals and sports events for the public. This resulted in a phenomenal list of artists and shows over the years and has put Brussels on the schedule of every international tour manager. The venue annually hosts an average of 110 events attended by over 650.000 fans.

item.title: Art Base
item.body:
Multi-functional exhibition and concert centre in the heart of Brussels, focusing on Latino, Indian, Greek, classical music and gypsy jazz with a very intimate, close to thee performers atmosphere.

Check the website to know what’s on!

item.title: Ateliers Claus
item.body:
Exists since 2006, primarily as an artistic studio and working place, but more and more as an exciting stage for up and coming musicians. There's room for Belgian and international artists as long as they're exciting, experimental, adventurous and unique. Between art and rock'n'roll!

Check the website to know what’s on!

item.title: Le Botanique
item.body:
When the Botanique was built it was a major scientific research temple with a very large variety of exotic plants, flowers and trees. Now it's one the most important concert venues of Brussels with an incredible pop rock programmation of excellent quality throughout the whole year.

Check the website to know what's on!

item.title: Magasin 4
item.body: Is a club founded in 1994 dedicated to alternative music : Hardcore, Funk, Punk, Alternative Rock, Ska, Pop, Experimental Musics, Chanson Française, Jazz and a lot of original fusions... A place to discover!

item.title: MuziekPublique
item.body:
Muziekpublique keeps music and dance traditions alive and kicking in Brussels through an ambitious programme of concerts, courses, and projects.

Check the website to know what’s on!
item.address: sq. du Bastion (Galerie de la Porte de Namur) 3/Bolwerksq. (Galerij van de Naamse Poort) 3

item.title: Vk*
item.body:
In the world of musical enrichment & innovation, it is well known that Vk* concerts has been playing a leading role in the Belgian alternative concert scene for years now. Besides established bands, Vk* tries time after time to give rising domestic and foreign bands a chance.

Check the website to know what’s on!

item.title: Sazz'n Jazz
item.body:
KulturSanat asbl organizes, in its activity room "Sazz N Jazz" , concerts of jazz and world music to promote the young groups coming from all horizons. In parallel to these concerts which constitute the principal activity of KulturSanat, training and courses including various artistic disciplines, such as the music, painting, theatre, cinema, literature, will be proposed by experienced artists and authors.

Workshops and seminars on the techniques ignored or little known on our premises will be directed by specialized guests.
KulturSanat makes a point of collaborating with other cultural and Community institutions to meet and discover other cultures and to bring a new dimension to the artistic and cultural life of Brussels.

item.title: Le Courant d'air
Ric’s art boat
Espace Senghor
item.body:
Espace Senghor/Centre Cuturel d'Etterbeek ASBL is a Cultural Center from the french speaking community situated in the European District of Brussels.
 
We have a beautiful hall from the early 20th century wIth a really nice accoustic. Its capacity is 250 seats.
 
Our program is mainly focused on intercultural activities held in various domains like theatre, dance performances, children programs and music of course.
 
Each year, we have about 15 World Music concerts in our hall and 4 Jazz concerts. We also set up programs dedicated to some particular cultures. During 3 or 4 days, we try to present different aspects of these cultures like music of course, but also fine arts, movies, or gastronomy... Some of the topic we had over the last years include Touaregs, Gipsies, Algeria, Brasil, Gnaouas, Madgascar...
 
Here are some of the most famous bands who played in our hall :
Tony Allen, Ebo Taylor, Bonga, Tigran Hamasyan, Maria Joao, Susana Baca, Trilok Gurtu and the Frikyiwa Familiy, Savina Yannatou, Omar Sosa, Amadou & Mariam, KCP 5 feat. Charlie Mariano, Okay Temiz, Viriginia Rodrigues, Dhafer Youssef, Habib Koite, Taraf de Haïdouks, Cheikh Lô, David Krakauer's Klezmer Madness, Marcos Valle, Ensemble Al Kindi, Richard Galliano, Shivkumar Sharma,…
